quote: So you see, imagination needs moodling - long, inefficient, happy idling, dawdling and puttering.
author: Brenda Ueland

quote: It never hurts to ask. Unless you ask for hurt.
author: Takayuki Ikkaku, Arisa Hosaka and Toshihiro Kawabat

quote: To the soul, there is hardly anything more healing than friendship.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: The art of war is simple enough. Find out where your enemy is. Get at him as soon as you can. Strike him as hard as you can, and keep moving on.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Ask yourself: Have you been kind today? Make kindness your daily modus operandi and change your world.
author: Annie Lennox

quote: Flowers never emit so sweet and strong a fragrance as before a storm. When a storm approaches thee, be as fragrant as a sweet-smelling flower.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Man seeketh in society comfort, use and protection.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: A technical objection is the first refuge of a scoundrel.
author: Heywood Broun

quote: Every minute you are thinking of evil, you might have been thinking of good instead. Refuse to pander to a morbid interest in your own misdeeds. Pick yourself up, be sorry, shake yourself, and go on again.
author: Evelyn Underhill

quote: Order is not pressure which is imposed on society from without, but an equilibrium which is set up from within.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset
